title: Michigan Left
body: I guess the Michigan Left could also be known as the Guangdong (广东) Left.

title: Vinegar!?
body: I hate when the soy sauce is vinegar!

title: Car Ride
body: Believe it or not, I actually survived my first car trip with a Chinese driver.

title: Long way from home
body: Tonight I could really tell that I was a long way from home...  And it was sweet.

title: Chinese name
body: My Chinese name is 周俊才.  Now I just have to learn some other Chinese words.

title: Wasabi
body: At all costs, keep the wasabi out of your nose and lungs!

title: Tomb Sweeping Day
body: No School today because it's tomb sweeping day.  I have no idea what that is.

title: No School Friday
body: No School Friday either because the kids have exams.  Easy week.

title: School-wide Dance-a-thon
body: My classes ended abruptly today when the entire school stopped on a moments notice to get their banners and tambourines and go march around the exercise yard.  Red China might not be so oppressive, but it sure is weird.

title: Running
body: I ran over 6km today.  Watch out America, when I get back I'll be one lean chick magnet :)

title: Large and In Charge
body: I literally drug a girl out of class kicking and screaming today.  (She was kicking we were both screaming).  And when I got back I got a round of applause.

title: Poker
body: I got boned in poker tonight.  But it was sweet to play again.  Hopefully next week goes better.

title: Fish Scales
body: If anyone is keeping a list of all the weird shit I've eaten over here, go ahead and add fish scales to the list :)

title: Discount Rack
body: Tonight's Big Discovery:  The discount rack at the bakery!  When its only 2元 for a kilogram of delicious bread, I feel like I should sneak out with it under my shirt even after I pay.

title: IT Job
body: The other night I got stuck out after the buses closed.  I found a guy who spoke english to help me get back.  Then he offered me a job interview at his video game programming company.

title: Another Job Offer
body: I got another Job offer today.  What was it?  I'll give you a clue:  It's a job that Model Bill never had.

title: Hong Kong
body: Going to Hong Kong for the weekend.  I'm celebrating the halfway point in my contract and the fact that it's may-day.

title: Back from Hong Kong
body: I made it back from Hong Kong, and it was sweet.  Now back to school.

title: Overtime
body: Alright, I actually scored some overtime shifts this weekend.  Maybe I won't leave here more broke than I came after all!

title: Teaching Sucks
body: China is co cool.  Too bad I have to do all this pesky teaching while I'm here.

title: Anti-Shirt
body: I just saw a woman wearing a T-shirt that said "This is absolutely not a shirt".

title: Return Flight
body:
If anyone knows how to book a flight and pay in Chinese currency please let me know.

Jen?  any thoughts?

title: Another Job Offer
body: Fifty percent commission selling wine.  I think I will try this one.  But it might be hard since I don't speak Chinese...  I guess I'll find out.

title: Joke about America
body:
A Chinese friend told me this joke tonight:

"Two Americans were pissing off a bridge.  One was from New York and one was from Kentucky.  The one from New York said, 'the water is very cold'.  The one from Kentucky said, 'the water is also very deep'."

title: Old Software
body: China is like a time portal for software.  Seriously.  I thought it was crazy that some of the computers at my school still used Windows 98, but today I asked to borrow a teacher's computer to check my email and it had Internet Explorer 5.  IE5!  I could have checked my email more easily by chewing on the loose end of the Ethernet cable!

title: Best Lunch Break Ever
body: At lunch I met a friend who gave me a free cellphone. Then I met a guy who had a guitar and wireless amp.  Now I can (kind of) read Chinese sheet music.  Best lunch break ever.

title: George almost ruined my first date
body: George, you almost made me strike out on a date last night.  I told this girl that I was going to America for a wedding in August, and for the next half hour she was convinced that I was getting married.

title: Track Workout
body: First track workout in over a year today.  Felt great; ran fast.

title: Flight Booked
body: I officially booked a flight back to America yesterday.  I should be back to Ohio at 6:17am on 1 July.  Price: 太贵了。

title: Bungee Jumping
body: I went Bungee Jumping.  Yeah, Awesome!  (45m)

title: Workin' for the weekend... Kind of
body: This seven day work-week is brutal.  I'm looking forward to the Dragon Boat Holiday!

title: Ready to go?
body: I love China and hate teaching.  It makes for a weird mix of emotion now that the end is near.

title: Longest Week Ever
body: Seriously, working seven days in a row sucks!  I hope I never do it again.  If we're lucky I won't deck a kid, but if one more little bastard sprays my eyes with perfume, I just might.

title: Holiday -- I made it!
body: Dragon Boat Holiday, here I come!  I only work two of the next seven days.

title: One Child Policy
body: Alright China, time to start enforcing the one child policy.  Or better yet, make it the zero child policy.

title: Cut My Braid
body: The time finally came.  I cut off my braid today.

title: Chinese Mafia
body: Some Chinese people taught me how to play mafia tonight. Then I taught them how to play mafia.

title: ALCS Champs
body: I'm officially adding the first item to my Christmas list:  A Cleveland Indians "1995 American League Champions"  Button.  I lost mine :'(

title: To-Do List
body: To Do in China:  Five days of teaching, then, five days of partying.  Alright!!

title: New To-Do List
body: To Do in China:  <del>Five</del> <del>Four</del> <del>Three</del> <del>Two</del> One day<del>s</del> of teaching, then, five days of partying. Alright!!

title: Friend or Food
body: Today I got about halfway through a lesson and paused to think of the next activity.  I had to look back at my lesson plan because I couldn't remember if I was teaching about "Pets" or "Food".  I think that says something good about the culture.

title: Addiction
body: Oh No!  I had a relapse into my McDonald's addiction yesterday.

title: Finalized Contract Deails
body: Well, I finalized my contract details today.   That means all the screwing and being screwed is finally finished.  It looks like my total earnings for these last four months will be around $200.

title: Heading Home
body: This is my last update from China.  I'll catch you all on the flip side.

title: Made It
body: I made it back to the land of blue skies and SUVs.  Readjusting hasn't been too hard so far.

title: Indians
body: I'm pretty sure the Cleveland Indians can't lose when I'm watching.  Even if I do fall asleep.

title: 61 miles
body: Today training ride(s) totaled 61 miles.  And I was on that little 10-speed mountain bike!

title: Bought a bike
body: I guess I'm adapted to the American lifestyle again.  I dropped $200 on a bike today.

title: Mustang
body: I think the mustang is just one giant money pit that will never be finished.

title: Bike Trip Today
body: I just finished the riverfest 5k (where Sarah Rospert totally destroyed me) and I'm heading out on the bicycle trip.  I'll post pictures of the trip and the pearl river cruise in about a week.

title: Bike Trip Bust
body: The bike trip didn't quite go as planned, but Sarah and I had a good three-day tour around west Michigan.  Pier-jumping is sweet.

title: Long Motorcycle Ride
body: Today was my first long motorcycle ride in almost a year.  As usual, I had to do some last minute surgery to get it road-worthy.  But I made it to CTY, and the trip was awesome!

title: Debt
body: I'm a slave to debt.  Avoid student loans at all costs.

title: Yoga
body: It turns out yoga is pretty cool.  But I guess I could use a little more flexibility.

title: Munchies
body: Oh Man!  I have to get these munchies under control.  All that getting fit I did the last four months is going to go to waste!

title: Finished Grading
body: Alright!  I'm done grading homework for the week!

title: Swimming Hole
body: I went swimming in a river with a rope swing and some super friendly townies and a creepy cave.  It was sweet!

title: Tesla Motors
body: I officially applied for a job at Tesla Motors.  And the best part is that it's temp work.  Hopefully I hear back soon.

title: Last Day
body: It's my last day at CTY.  So Sad :(  Look out GR Here I come.

title: Oil Spill
body: Well, I made it to GR, but not before spilling my bike's oil all over the turnpike and switching to the truck.

title: Wedding Successful
body: Congratulations George and Kristin!

title: Wisdom Teeth
body: I got my wisdom teeth out today. That's right I got both of them out even though only one was showing. It hurts!

title: Honda Repair
body: The repair of my Honda CX650 is officially underway.  Hopefully it goes great and doesn't cost too much.

title: Selling Everything
body: I guess selling everything I own isn't as easy as I thought it would be because nobody wants to buy any of it.  Everyone come to my garage sale this Friday and Saturday!

title: Motorcycle Parts
body: Motorcycle parts dealers are asses.  If they giving you a shipping time estimate, double it and append "from whenever we decide to order it".

title: Low Rider
body: Good Bye Low Rider.  Last night I took the low rider couch to the drive-in (which was awesome) and left it there for some other lucky soul to use.

title: Blood
body: I'm thinking that I should start selling blood to make a little cash.  But I'll have to do a little prep to get over the thought of that needle.

title: Mexican Pizza
body: Mexican Pizza!!!! So Delicious!

title: Boat
body: My boat is on ebay and the reserve is met.  Maybe I'll get these student loans paid off after all!

title: jQuery
body: jQuery is the shiznit.

title: Texas
body: I'm leaving for Texas on my motorcycle today.  You can expect to start seeing some exciting photo galleries again soon!

title: Texas Part 2
body: My roadtrip to Texas was pretty much a bust.  I'm back in Ohio with a broken motorcycle.

title: Grand Rapids Visit
body: Ann Arbor and Grand Rapids were awesome.  Now I'm in Chicago and it's awesome too.  The best part so far was the Espanish Senorita on the bus.  ;-)

title: Softball
body: It turns out that there is a specific muscle in the right side of your mid-section known as the "softball muscle". If you play two nights in a row it hurts.

title: Interstates
body: Interstates take the fun out of traveling; avoid them at all costs.  Wolf Creek Pass was totally amazing.

title: Grand Canyon
body: The Grand Canyon was a little touristy, but still sweet and great hiking.  One day I'll hike from rim to river and back in one day.  That's 'not recommended'.

title: LA
body: Made it to L.A.  Looking for band-mates.

title: Recession?  Not.
body: Recession?  What recession?  I got a job after five hours of looking.

title: Making Money
body: I've officially made more money than I've spent since coming to California.

title: Moved In
body: I'm moved into my new place.  And I've no longer made more than I've spent...

title: Wedding Rings
body: It turns out Chinese girls don't always wear rings when they get married...  Even in America

title: Mercedes-Benz
body: I must be the pimp-daddy of the hood because I'm pretty sure I'm about to buy my first Mercedes-Benz.

title: Mercedes-Benz follow-up
body: I must be the pimp-daddy of the hood because I<del>'m pretty sure I'm about to buy</del> just bought my first Mercedes-Benz.

title: Cold!
body: The outside temperature got down to 55° F today.  That's the coldest day I've had since February and I could feel it.

title: Quarter Tattoo
body: There is a George Washington shaped burn in my forearm because I rested it on a hot quarter.

title: LA Metro
body: My thoughts on the LA metro:  I would gladly trade my right to freely elect government officials for a transportation infrastructure like they have in China.

title: Ubuntu Countdown
body: If you've been wondering what the countdown (below) is, it's counting down until the next release of Ubuntu.

title: Yamaha Twins
body: The auto auction guy wants a little too much for his Yamaha Maxim and Seca Twins.  Maybe he'll change his mind in a week.

title: Blood Donation
body: I am now officially a blood* donor**

title: Stopped Raining
body: Alright; it finally stopped raining.  Now I can get out and do some lane splitting!

title: Nine Coins
body: If you're looking for something to occupy (and exercise) your mind, take a look at this extra credit problem that I gave my class. You guys can get bonus points too :)

title: Peter Pan
body: I was peter pan for Halloween.  It wasn't quite a scandalicious as the spice girls, but I was happy with the amount of skin that was showing.

title: Election Day
body:
I feel I've really succeeded in being an "apathetic citizen" since I didn't find out it was election day until 10:18pm.

I truly believe that not voting is better than perpetuating the vote-for-whoever-will-screw-me-least mentality.

title: Time Change
body: Ahhhh!  Time change is the worst!  Why do we do it!?  Don't say it's to save energy; I turn my lights on at 5:00 instead of 6:00 now!  I think I'm going to start going to bed at 8:00pm and getting up at 4:00am.

title: Soldiers
body: Stop referring to soldiers as heros!    Even postsecret caved.

title: Valves
body: In a few hours (or days) I will have completed my first motorcycle valve adjustment.  Hopefully the bike still runs when I'm done :)

title: Lift
body: Don't let the stuff you learned in school get in the way of your natural insight.

title: ACDC
body: Rock 'n' roll ain't noise pollution, but AC☇DC sure is.

title: Feelings
body: Half-awake, drunk, and about-to-faint are remarkably similar sensations.  The most interesting part is wondering, later, at how limited my perception had been.  Could there be a way to reflect on my usual mindset with such clarity?

title: Wikipedia
body: Wikipedia isn't great despite being open. It's great because it's open.

title: Mirrored Dreams
body: Help me test a hypothesis: Try to note whether your body is mirrored in your dreams.  Is that mole on your left cheek instead of your right?  Which arm is your scar on?  Which hand is dominant?

title: Neck Tie
body: Well, I'm pretty good at tying my tie now.  I can't shake the feeling that that increased my tool-factor a little bit.

title: New Taste
body: It's official; I have a new favorite band: The Hold Steady.

title: Motorcycle Guitar
body: My next invention will be a device to carry a guitar on a motorcycle.  That will be so useful.

title: Christmas Break
body: Christmas break is even more rewarding as a teacher than it is as a student.

title: LAX
body: The ticketing counter of terminal six is not the ideal place to spend a night, but at least there is some good people watching.

body: Midnight Jamming is way easier with a guitar strap... even if it is a pink fuzzy one.

body: New Lappy.  Thanks Santa!  Expect website updates soon.

body: One day of Pre-Algebra left!

title: Multitasking

title: Daydreaming
body: Daydream - v - To invite spontaneous inspiration by becoming lost in thought, often involves temporarily forgetting the outside world.

title: Racism
body: Racism - n - The belief that the way you treat a person of a different race should be based on anything other than their individual personality and actions.

title: Understand
body: Understand - v - To fundamentally know how and why something works.  Not to be confused with the ability to predict an outcome or the ability to calculate an answer.

title: Tolerance
body: Tolerance - n - The feigned appreciation of another culture or demographic by one who wants to be perceived as politically correct. - A cheap and inadequate substitute for true appreciation.

title: Foresight
body: Foresight - n - The ability to make decisions based on their likely consequences - Friend of stability, enemy of spontaneity.

Yesterday at the airport a guy in a camouflage hat with an american flag sat down next to me, got out his laptop, opened up an ascii-armored RSA Private key, which I clearly saw, VNCed into a remote linux desktop over public wifi, and proceeded to search stack overflow for how to articles. Meanwhile, his wife and kids cheered, "go daddy go; crack those keys".

I'm pretty sure that dude is my arch nemesis.

If someone has a strong, random, 20-character password, it could take centuries. But most people use passwords like "horselover49", "letmein" or "penis" (though the latter might be too short), which are much easier to crack.
